meta.name: Automated FTP File Migration with Smart Cleanup and Email Notifications

parameters.content:
# üöÄ FTP FILE MIGRATION WORKFLOW

## Overview:
Automated file transfer between FTP servers with comprehensive error handling and notifications.

## Key Features:
‚úÖ Scheduled execution (daily at 2 AM)
‚úÖ Smart file filtering
‚úÖ Secure transfer with validation
‚úÖ Source cleanup after success
‚úÖ Email notifications (success + error)
‚úÖ Comprehensive logging

## Quick Start:
1. Configure FTP credentials
2. Adjust schedule and filters
3. Set up email notifications
4. Test with small files first
5. Monitor execution logs

‚ö†Ô∏è **IMPORTANT**: Test thoroughly before production!

## üìÅ FILE PROCESSING PIPELINE

### Current Filter: 
**Text & Data Files Only**
- .txt, .csv, .json, .xml

### Common Alternatives:
üìÑ **Documents**: `\.(pdf|doc|docx)$`
üñºÔ∏è **Images**: `\.(jpg|jpeg|png|gif)$`
üìä **Data**: `\.(csv|json|xml|xlsx)$`
üì¶ **Archives**: `\.(zip|rar|7z|tar)$`
üéµ **Media**: `\.(mp4|mp3|avi|mov)$`

### Size Limits:
- Small: < 10MB
- Medium: 10MB - 100MB  
- Large: > 100MB (adjust timeouts)

### Processing Order:
1Ô∏è‚É£ List files from source
2Ô∏è‚É£ Filter by criteria
3Ô∏è‚É£ Download to temp storage
4Ô∏è‚É£ Upload to destination
5Ô∏è‚É£ Validate transfer
6Ô∏è‚É£ Clean up source

üîÑ **Remove Filter node to transfer ALL files**

## üîí SECURITY BEST PRACTICES

### Connection Security:
üîê **Use SFTP** instead of FTP (port 22)
üîë **SSH Keys** preferred over passwords
üåê **IP Whitelisting** on FTP servers
üîí **VPN/Tunnel** for sensitive data

### Credential Management:
üóùÔ∏è **Dedicated Service Accounts**
üîÑ **Regular Rotation** (monthly/quarterly)
üìù **Minimum Permissions** (read source, write dest)
üö´ **No Shared Accounts**

### Data Protection:
üîê **Encryption in Transit** (TLS/SSL)
üóÇÔ∏è **File Integrity Checks** (checksums)
üìã **Audit Logging** (all operations)
üïê **Retention Policies** (log cleanup)

### Access Control:
üë§ **Role-Based Access**
üö™ **Principle of Least Privilege**
üìä **Access Reviews** (quarterly)
üîç **Activity Monitoring**

### Compliance:
üìú **GDPR/CCPA** considerations
üìã **SOX/HIPAA** requirements
üè¢ **Corporate Policies**
üìù **Documentation Requirements**

## ‚ö° PERFORMANCE OPTIMIZATION

### File Size Considerations:
üìÑ **Small Files** (< 10MB): Default settings
üìä **Medium Files** (10-100MB): Increase timeouts
üì¶ **Large Files** (> 100MB): Extended timeouts + monitoring
üé¨ **Huge Files** (> 1GB): Consider alternative methods

### Timeout Settings:
‚è∞ **Connection**: 30 seconds
‚è∞ **Download**: 300 seconds (5 min)
‚è∞ **Upload**: 300 seconds (5 min)
‚è∞ **Large Files**: 600+ seconds (10+ min)

### Network Optimization:
üåê **Peak Hours**: Schedule during off-peak
üìä **Bandwidth**: Monitor usage patterns
üîÑ **Parallel Processing**: For multiple files
üìà **Resume Support**: For interrupted transfers



üéØ **Target**: < 5 min per 100MB file

## üîß TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE

### Common Issues & Solutions:

üîå **Connection Failures:**
- Check server status & firewall
- Verify credentials & permissions
- Test network connectivity
- Review SSL/TLS settings

‚è±Ô∏è **Timeout Errors:**
- Increase timeout values
- Check file sizes vs. settings
- Monitor network speed
- Split large transfers

üîë **Authentication Issues:**
- Verify username/password
- Check account lockouts
- Test credential expiration
- Review permission changes

üìÅ **File Operation Errors:**
- Confirm file existence
- Check read/write permissions
- Verify disk space availability
- Test file locking status

üíæ **Memory/Performance:**
- Monitor n8n server resources
- Adjust concurrent executions
- Implement file size limits
- Consider batch processing

### Debug Steps:
1Ô∏è‚É£ **Check Logs**: Execution history
2Ô∏è‚É£ **Test Credentials**: Manual FTP connection
3Ô∏è‚É£ **Verify Paths**: Directory structure
4Ô∏è‚É£ **Network Test**: Ping/telnet servers
5Ô∏è‚É£ **Resource Check**: CPU/Memory/Disk

üìû **Escalation**: Contact system administrators

## ‚öôÔ∏è CONFIGURATION CHECKLIST

### Pre-Deployment:
‚òê **FTP Credentials**: Source & destination tested
‚òê **SMTP Settings**: Email notifications configured
‚òê **File Filters**: Appropriate patterns set
‚òê **Paths**: Source & destination directories verified
‚òê **Schedule**: Cron expression configured
‚òê **Timeouts**: Adjusted for expected file sizes
‚òê **Permissions**: Read source, write destination
‚òê **Network**: Connectivity between all systems

### Testing Phase:
‚òê **Disable Cleanup**: Comment out source deletion
‚òê **Small Files**: Test with 1-2 small files first
‚òê **Error Scenarios**: Test failure conditions
‚òê **Email Alerts**: Verify notifications work
‚òê **Logs Review**: Check execution history
‚òê **Performance**: Monitor transfer speeds

### Production Deployment:
‚òê **Enable Cleanup**: Activate source deletion
‚òê **Monitor First Run**: Watch initial execution
‚òê **Set Alerts**: Configure monitoring thresholds
‚òê **Document Config**: Save settings & passwords
‚òê **Schedule Review**: Confirm timing works
‚òê **Backup Strategy**: Plan for rollback

### Post-Deployment:
‚òê **Daily Monitoring**: Check success rates
‚òê **Weekly Reviews**: Analyze performance
‚òê **Monthly Audits**: Security & compliance
‚òê **Quarterly Updates**: Credential rotation

nodes.name: Daily Schedule (2 AM)
nodes.notes:
SCHEDULE TRIGGER CONFIGURATION:

üìÖ CURRENT SCHEDULE: Daily at 2:00 AM (server time)

‚è∞ SCHEDULE EXAMPLES:
- Daily at specific time: 0 2 * * *
- Every 6 hours: 0 */6 * * *
- Weekdays at 8 AM: 0 8 * * 1-5
- Weekly on Sunday 2 AM: 0 2 * * 0
- Monthly on 1st at midnight: 0 0 1 * *

üîß CONFIGURATION STEPS:
1. Click on this node to edit
2. Modify 'Cron Expression' field
3. Use cron expression generator if needed
4. Test with 'Execute Node' button

‚ö†Ô∏è IMPORTANT CONSIDERATIONS:
- Server timezone affects execution time
- Consider maintenance windows
- Avoid peak business hours
- Account for server load and resources
- Plan for daylight saving time changes

üí° TESTING TIP:
- Use '*/5 * * * *' for every 5 minutes during testing
- Change back to production schedule after validation

üåç TIMEZONE SETTINGS:
- Current: Europe/Warsaw (GMT+1/+2)
- Modify in workflow settings if needed
- Ensure consistency across all environments

nodes.name: List Files - Source FTP
nodes.notes:
SOURCE FTP SERVER CONFIGURATION:

üîë CREDENTIALS SETUP:
1. Navigate to: Settings ‚Üí Credentials ‚Üí Create New
2. Select 'FTP' credential type
3. Name: 'Source FTP Server'
4. Enter connection details:
   - Host: source-ftp-server.com
   - Port: 21 (FTP) or 22 (SFTP)
   - Username: your_username
   - Password: your_password
5. Test connection before saving

üìÅ PATH CONFIGURATION:
- Absolute path: /home/user/files/
- Relative path: files/folder/
- Root directory: /
- Current example: /source/directory/

üîç OPERATION SETTINGS:
- Operation: 'List' (to discover files)
- Recursive: true (includes subdirectories)
- Returns file metadata: name, size, date, permissions

‚öôÔ∏è ADVANCED OPTIONS:
- Connection timeout: 30 seconds (default)
- Data timeout: 60 seconds
- Keep connection alive: true
- Passive mode: true (recommended)

üõ°Ô∏è SECURITY RECOMMENDATIONS:
- Use SFTP (port 22) when possible
- Enable key-based authentication
- Implement IP whitelisting
- Use dedicated service accounts
- Regular credential rotation

üêõ TROUBLESHOOTING:
- Connection timeout: Check firewall settings
- Permission denied: Verify user permissions
- Path not found: Ensure directory exists
- Authentication failed: Check credentials

üìä EXPECTED OUTPUT:
- Array of file objects
- Each object contains: name, size, date, type
- Empty array if no files found

nodes.name: Filter Files
nodes.notes:
FILE FILTERING & SELECTION:

üîç CURRENT FILTER LOGIC:
- File Extension Match: \.(txt|csv|json|xml)$
- Case-sensitive matching enabled
- Regex pattern matching

üìù COMMON FILTER PATTERNS:

üìÑ DOCUMENTS:
- Office files: \.(doc|docx|xls|xlsx|ppt|pptx)$
- PDF files: \.pdf$
- Text files: \.(txt|rtf|md)$

üñºÔ∏è IMAGES:
- Common formats: \.(jpg|jpeg|png|gif|bmp)$
- High-res images: \.(tiff|tga|raw)$
- Vector graphics: \.(svg|eps|ai)$

üìä DATA FILES:
- Structured data: \.(csv|json|xml|yaml)$
- Database files: \.(sql|db|sqlite)$
- Log files: \.(log|txt)$

üì¶ ARCHIVES:
- Compressed files: \.(zip|rar|7z|tar|gz)$

üîß ADVANCED FILTERING OPTIONS:

üìè SIZE-BASED FILTERING:
- Add condition: {{ $json.size > 1048576 }} (> 1MB)
- Small files only: {{ $json.size < 10240 }} (< 10KB)
- Size range: {{ $json.size >= 1024 && $json.size <= 5242880 }}

üìÖ DATE-BASED FILTERING:
- Recent files: {{ $json.date > $now.minus({days: 7}) }}
- Older files: {{ $json.date < $now.minus({months: 1}) }}
- Specific date range: Use date comparisons

üìõ NAME PATTERN FILTERING:
- Starts with: ^report_.*
- Ends with: .*_backup$
- Contains: .*important.*
- Exclude pattern: ^(?!temp_).*

‚ö†Ô∏è FILTER BYPASS:
- Remove this node to transfer ALL files
- Be cautious with unrestricted transfers
- Consider disk space and bandwidth

üéØ TESTING FILTERS:
1. Use 'Execute Node' to test filter logic
2. Check output to verify correct files selected
3. Adjust regex patterns as needed
4. Validate with different file types

üí° PERFORMANCE TIP:
- Specific filters reduce processing time
- Avoid overly complex regex patterns
- Test filters with representative data

nodes.name: Download File
nodes.notes:
FILE DOWNLOAD OPERATION:

üì• DOWNLOAD CONFIGURATION:
- Operation: 'Download File'
- Binary Property: 'file_data' (stores file content)
- Dynamic path: {{ $json.name }} (from previous node)
- Uses same credentials as listing operation

üéØ IMPORTANT SETTINGS:
- Path Expression: {{ $json.name }}
- Binary Data Property: file_data
- Timeout: 300 seconds (5 minutes)
- Auto-retry: 3 attempts on failure

üìä PERFORMANCE CONSIDERATIONS:

‚è±Ô∏è TIMEOUT SETTINGS:
- Small files (<10MB): Default timeout (60s)
- Medium files (10MB-100MB): 300 seconds
- Large files (>100MB): 600+ seconds
- Adjust based on network speed

üóÇÔ∏è FILE SIZE LIMITS:
- n8n default: 150MB per execution
- Large files may cause memory issues
- Consider file size filtering
- Split large transfers into batches

üîÑ RETRY LOGIC:
- Automatic retry on network errors
- 3 attempts with exponential backoff
- Preserves original file on failure
- Error details logged for debugging

üíæ MEMORY MANAGEMENT:
- Files stored in n8n temporary memory
- Automatic cleanup after workflow completion
- Monitor server RAM usage for large files
- Consider streaming for very large files

‚ö†Ô∏è ERROR SCENARIOS:
- Network interruption: Auto-retry enabled
- File permissions: Check source server access
- File locked: Retry after delay
- Disk space: Monitor n8n server storage
- Timeout: Increase timeout for large files

üîç MONITORING:
- Check execution logs for download times
- Monitor network bandwidth usage
- Track success/failure rates
- Set up alerts for repeated failures

üõ†Ô∏è TROUBLESHOOTING:
- Download fails: Check file permissions
- Slow downloads: Verify network speed
- Timeout errors: Increase timeout setting
- Memory errors: Reduce batch size or file size limit

üìà OUTPUT DATA:
- Binary data stored in 'file_data' property
- Original filename preserved
- File metadata available for next nodes
- Ready for upload to destination server

nodes.name: Upload to Destination
nodes.notes:
DESTINATION FTP UPLOAD:

üéØ UPLOAD CONFIGURATION:
- Operation: 'Upload File'
- Source: Binary data from 'file_data' property
- Dynamic destination path with filename preservation
- Automatic directory creation enabled

üîë CREDENTIALS SETUP:
1. Create separate FTP credential: 'Destination FTP Server'
2. Verify write permissions on target server
3. Test connectivity before production use
4. Use different credentials than source for security

üìÅ PATH STRUCTURE EXAMPLES:

üóÇÔ∏è PRESERVE ORIGINAL STRUCTURE:
/destination/directory/{{ $json.name }}

üìÖ DATE-BASED ORGANIZATION:
/files/{{ $now.format('YYYY/MM/DD') }}/{{ $json.name }}

üìä TYPE-BASED ORGANIZATION:
/files/{{ $json.name.split('.').pop() }}/{{ $json.name }}

üë§ USER-BASED ORGANIZATION:
/users/{{ $json.owner || 'system' }}/{{ $json.name }}

‚öôÔ∏è UPLOAD OPTIONS:

‚úÖ ENABLED FEATURES:
- createDirectories: true (auto-create missing folders)
- preserveTimestamp: true (maintain original dates)
- overwriteExisting: false (prevent accidental overwrites)

üîÑ ADDITIONAL OPTIONS:
- Resume broken uploads: true
- Verify after upload: true
- Atomic upload: true (temp file ‚Üí rename)
- Permission setting: 644 (read/write owner, read others)

üõ°Ô∏è SECURITY MEASURES:
- Separate credentials for source/destination
- Write-only permissions where possible
- Regular credential rotation
- Audit trail maintenance

‚ö° PERFORMANCE OPTIMIZATION:
- Parallel uploads for multiple files
- Compression for large text files
- Resume capability for interrupted transfers
- Bandwidth limiting for peak hours

üéØ SUCCESS VALIDATION:
- File existence check after upload
- Size comparison (source vs destination)
- Checksum verification (optional)
- Timestamp preservation validation

‚ö†Ô∏è ERROR SCENARIOS & SOLUTIONS:
- Disk full: Monitor destination storage
- Permission denied: Verify write access
- Connection lost: Auto-retry with backoff
- Filename conflicts: Use unique naming

üìä MONITORING METRICS:
- Upload speed (MB/s)
- Success rate percentage
- Average file size
- Total data transferred
- Error frequency and types

üîß TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE:
- Upload fails: Check destination permissions
- Slow uploads: Verify network connectivity
- Directory errors: Ensure path format is correct
- Authentication issues: Validate credentials
- File corruption: Enable checksum verification

üìà OUTPUT INFORMATION:
- Upload success status
- Destination file path
- Transfer duration
- File size confirmation
- Any warnings or errors

nodes.name: Upload Success?
nodes.notes:
SUCCESS VALIDATION:

CHECKS PERFORMED:
- Upload operation success status
- File transfer completion
- No error conditions

NEXT STEPS:
- TRUE: Proceed to cleanup (delete source)
- FALSE: Route to error handling

ADDITIONAL VALIDATIONS:
- File size comparison
- Checksum verification
- Timestamp validation

CONFIGURATION:
- Adjust condition based on FTP node output
- May need to check different properties
- Test with actual transfer results

nodes.name: Delete Source File
nodes.notes:
SOURCE FILE CLEANUP:

OPERATION: DELETE
- Removes file from source server
- Only after successful upload
- Prevents duplicate processing

SAFETY MEASURES:
- Only runs after upload verification
- Maintains transfer logs
- Consider backup retention period

ALTERNATIVE STRATEGIES:
1. MOVE to 'processed' folder instead of delete
2. RENAME with timestamp suffix
3. ARCHIVE to compressed format

RISK MITIGATION:
- Test thoroughly before production
- Implement rollback procedures
- Monitor deletion operations

IMPORTANT: Disable this step for testing!

nodes.name: Send Email Success Alert
nodes.notes:
EMAIL SUCCESS NOTIFICATION:

üìß SUCCESS NOTIFICATION SETTINGS:
- Sends confirmation email for successful transfers
- Includes transfer details and file information
- Uses same SMTP credentials as error notifications
- Helps maintain audit trail of all operations

‚úÖ EMAIL CONTENT:
- Timestamp of successful completion
- Filename and size of transferred file
- Operation type and status confirmation
- Summary of all workflow steps completed

üì¨ NOTIFICATION FREQUENCY:
- One email per successful file transfer
- Can be modified to send daily/weekly summaries
- Consider batch notifications for high-volume transfers

‚öôÔ∏è CUSTOMIZATION OPTIONS:

üìä SUMMARY REPORTS:
- Change to HTML format for better presentation
- Include charts or statistics
- Add file thumbnails for images
- Include transfer speed metrics

üìù CONTENT MODIFICATIONS:
- Add recipient-specific information
- Include business context or next steps
- Add links to file locations
- Include compliance or audit information

üë• RECIPIENT MANAGEMENT:
- Multiple recipients with CC/BCC
- Different notifications for different teams
- Role-based notification content
- Escalation for VIP files or large transfers

üîï NOTIFICATION CONTROL:
- Add conditions to skip notifications for certain files
- Time-based notification suppression (e.g., only during business hours)
- File size thresholds for notifications
- Success rate thresholds (only notify if multiple successes)

üìà REPORTING INTEGRATION:
- Can feed into business intelligence systems
- Generate compliance reports
- Track SLA compliance
- Monitor operational efficiency

NOTE: For high-volume environments, consider implementing batch notifications to avoid email flooding
